item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3759-3760; text as passed Senate: CR S3759-3760; text of measure as introduced: CR S3753)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S3759-3760; text as passed Senate: CR S3759-3760; text of measure as introduced: CR S3753)

item.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

summary.text:
Welcomes: (1) the official resignation of Askar Akayev as President of the Kyrgyz Republic; and (2) the close relationship between the United States and the Kyrgyz Republic.

Supports the the Kyrgyz Republic's independence and territorial integrity.

Urges: (1) strong support for democratic reform in the Kyrgyz Republic; (2) the interim government in the Kyrgyz Republic to move swiftly toward the democratic government ratified by the people of Kyrgyz by holding free presidential elections in July 2005; and (3) the people of the Kyrgyz Republic to take advantage of the readiness of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) to expand its assistance in preparing for free and fair presidential elections in the Kyrgyz Republic.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Welcomes: (1) the official resignation of Askar Akayev as President of the Kyrgyz Republic; and (2) the close relationship between the United States and the Kyrgyz Republic.

Supports the the Kyrgyz Republic's independence and territorial integrity.

Urges: (1) strong support for democratic reform in the Kyrgyz Republic; (2) the interim government in the Kyrgyz Republic to move swiftly toward the democratic government ratified by the people of Kyrgyz by holding free presidential elections in July 2005; and (3) the people of the Kyrgyz Republic to take advantage of the readiness of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) to expand its assistance in preparing for free and fair presidential elections in the Kyrgyz Republic.

bill.title: A resolution urging the United States to increase its efforts to ensure democratic reform in the Kyrgyz Republic.

item.title: A resolution urging the United States to increase its efforts to ensure democratic reform in the Kyrgyz Republic.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
